trans-unit.source: Sends data on a connected socket.

seg-source.mrk: Sends data on a connected socket.

target.mrk: Sends data on a connected socket.

trans-unit.source: Parameters
The connected socket identifier (SocketID) as returned by a TCPConnect() function.

seg-source.mrk: The connected socket identifier (SocketID) as returned by a TCPConnect() function.

target.mrk: The connected socket identifier (SocketID) as returned by a TCPConnect() function.

trans-unit.source: binary/string to be send to the connected socket.

seg-source.mrk: binary/string to be send to the connected socket.

target.mrk: binary/string to be send to the connected socket.

trans-unit.source: Return Value
the number of bytes sent to the connected socket.

seg-source.mrk: the number of bytes sent to the connected socket.

target.mrk: the number of bytes sent to the connected socket.

trans-unit.source: 0 and sets the @error flag to non-zero.

seg-source.mrk: 0 and sets the @error flag to non-zero.

target.mrk: 0 and sets the @error flag to non-zero.

trans-unit.source: @error:
Windows API WSAGetError return value (see MSDN).
Remarks
If Unicode strings need to be transmitted they must be encoded/decoded with StringToBinary()/BinaryToString().

seg-source.mrk: If Unicode strings need to be transmitted they must be encoded/decoded with StringToBinary()/BinaryToString().

target.mrk: If Unicode strings need to be transmitted they must be encoded/decoded with StringToBinary()/BinaryToString().

trans-unit.source: Related
StringToBinary, TCPConnect, TCPListen, TCPRecv, TCPStartup, TCPTimeout (Option)
Example
Example 1
Start First clicking on "1. Server"
Then start a second instance of the script selecting "2. Client"
